title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: The Liberty Hotel in Boston settled a discrimination complaint for $10,000 after wrongly accusing Ansley Baker of being a man.
The Massachusetts Commission Against Discrimination filed the complaint; the hotel agreed to policy updates and employee anti-discrimination training.
Baker plans to file a civil lawsuit for punitive damages, claiming security's actions and hotel statements were maliciously false.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons coach Raheem Morris retracts accusations of Patriots mimicking Atlanta's snap count after 24-23 loss.
The alleged 'clapgate' incident involved Falcons claiming Patriots clapped to simulate Atlanta QB's signals.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel denies any wrongdoing, attributing noises to fans and player misunderstanding.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman is opting out of his two-year, $80 million contract with the Boston Red Sox to enter free agency.
Bregman, 32, recorded .273/.360/.462 with 18 home runs and 62 RBIs across 114 games in the 2025 season.
Red Sox may attempt to retain Bregman, but other teams like the Tigers and Mariners are interested in the third baseman.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots are exploring options for roster upgrades before the NFL trade deadline at 4 p.m. Tuesday.
New England considers balancing current gains with future assets amid trade interest in players like Jaylen Waddle and Anfernee Jennings.
The Patriots face competition from teams like Dallas for potential trades involving edge rushers in the final trading hours.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returned to the Bruins' lineup after a lower-body injury, contributing to a 5-1-0 season record with him.
Lindholm and his fiancée welcomed their daughter, Magnolia, celebrating the homage to their engagement under a magnolia tree.
Lindholm's presence improved Bruins' defensive performance, lowering goals allowed from 4.25 to 2.3 per game when he's playing.

title: Stefon Diggs playfully roasts Cardi B’s dance moves during Gillette Stadium appearance
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Cardi B attended the Patriots game at Gillette Stadium, supporting boyfriend Stefon Diggs from the owner's suite.
Stefon Diggs scored an 11-yard touchdown, noting Cardi B's attempt to celebrate his moves as 'shaky.'
The Patriots defeated the Falcons by one point, extending their win streak to six games with a 29-28 victory.

title: A bipartisan group of Mass. lawmakers called on Markey and Warren to help end the shutdown
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: A bipartisan group of 32 Massachusetts lawmakers urged Senators Markey and Warren to end the current government shutdown.
Massachusetts lawmakers highlighted the shutdown's impact on SNAP benefits, small businesses, and federal employees in the state.
Markey and Warren are called to support a short-term spending bill, opposing measures to cut health insurance subsidies.

title: ‘Unaffordable and nearly unlivable’: What readers want Mayor Wu and City Councilors to prioritize
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston voters express strong concerns about housing affordability, making it a key issue in the mayoral and City Council elections.
Public safety and Massachusetts Avenue's crisis remain top priorities, affecting residents' quality of life and community safety perception.
Immigration policies spark division among Boston residents, influencing discussions on resource allocation and community trust.

title: Business confidence in Massachusetts drops again, report says
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Massachusetts business confidence fell in October, with the index at pessimistic levels for eight months, matching the 2020 pandemic period.
Factors affecting confidence include rising prices, federal disruptions, tariffs, and slowing employment, according to the AIM Business Confidence Index.
Federal government shutdown hampers economic data analysis, impacting productivity assessments, as reported by AIM and economists.

title: Boston Legacy FC announce date of 2026 home opener
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Boston Legacy FC will debut in the NWSL at Gillette Stadium on March 14, 2026.
The expansion team is set to play in Foxborough while renovations at White Stadium continue.
Legacy FC must sign a full squad without a traditional draft, aided by $1,065,000 allocation money.
